clinical_study.brief_title: Back to the Traditional: Anti-COX Drugs Can Improve the Outcome of COVID-19 Patients Admitted to ICU
clinical_study.official_title: Back to the Traditional: Anti-COX Drugs Can Improve the Outcome of COVID-19 Patients Admitted to ICU

brief_summary.textblock: Retrospective multicenter study to evaluate the data of COVID-19 patients who were admitted to university hospitals in relation to their recent administration or maintenance on non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAID) prior to have COVID-19 disease and to analyze it in relation to outcome of these patients.

detailed_description.textblock: The data contained in hospital registry were collected, categorized into demographic, previous medical history, the use of NSAID as maintenance therapy or its recent administration before diagnosis of COVID-19 disease, presenting manifestations, laboratory and CT findings, applied therapies or interventions. Outcomes will be categorized as survival and non-survival outcome. Survivors will be subdivided as complete recovery or recovery with getting new morbidities. Mortality was subdivided as total hospital and ICU mortality. Data will be statistically analyzed in relation to outcomes

primary_outcome.description: number of patients who were died secondary to COVID-19 disease or its complications

arm_group.description: included patients who did not receive NSAID prior to having COVID-19 disease
included patients who received acetylsalicylic acid (ASA) prior to having COVID-19 disease
included patients who received celecoxib (CEL) prior to having COVID-19 disease
included patients who received miscellaneous NSAID other than ASA or CEL prior to having COVID-19 disease
